intro: Hedeoma hirta, commonly known as hairy hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. Hedeoma hirta is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
